messages.title: Don't trust Theresa
messages.content: Theresa May completely failed to control immigration as Home Secretary and since she's been in government net migration has risen by more than 1.8 million people.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Theresa May failed to control immigration as Home Secretary with net migration rising by more than 1.8 million people.
Opposition to spending £14 billion a year on so-called 'foreign aid'.
Criticism of the European Court of Human Rights and the current inability to deport criminals due to the court's decisions.
Desire to protect British fishermen from future Brussels controls.
Since 2010, Conservatives have paid £50 billion of EU membership fees that could have employed tens of thousands of nurses and carers in the NHS.
Concerns about national security being undermined by cuts of 20,000 officers and armed forces personnel since 2010.

issues.economy: Conservatives have paid £50 billion of EU membership fees.
issues.governance: Criticism of Theresa May's governance and failure to control immigration.
issues.health: Conservatives could have employed tens of thousands of nurses and carers in our NHS with the money paid for EU membership fees.
issues.immigration: Theresa May's government has seen net migration rising to over 1.8 million.

leaflet.personalStatement: Vote for a true Brexit candidate. Worked locally as a bus driver, lived and worked in Switzerland and France in the hospitality industry and am married to a French wife.

quotes.text: Since 2010, May’s Tories have paid £50 billion of EU membership fees. This money should have employed tens of thousands of nurses and carers in our NHS.

images.caption: Dean Milliken - UKIP Candidate for Welwyn Hatfield.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Claims that Grant Shapps, the opponent, is a 'self-confessed remainer.'
